conclusion: Identify the process as cyclic: A → B → C → D → A.
State A has a temperature of 27°C, which is 300 K.
The pressure at state A is 1 × 10^5 Pa.
The pressure at state B is 1 × 10^5 Pa.
The volume at state A is 3 L.
The volume at state B is 4 L.
The ideal gas law is pV = nRT.
Relate states A and B using the ideal gas law: (p_A V_A) / T_A = (p_B V_B) / T_B.
Substitute known values: (1 × 10^5 Pa)(3 L) / 300 K = (1 × 10^5 Pa)(4 L) / T_B.
Convert T_B to Celsius: T_B = 400 K - 273.15 = 126.85°C.
